events.name: Bi-Monthly BTC in SG Meetup
events.description: Let's all get together where delicious food & drinks are sold for BTC, hobnob about the bitcoin lifestyle & entrepreneurship scene in town, and kick this meetup off. If you're interesting in giving a talk to the BTC community in SG, sharing your idea & startup, getting beta users, etc., let me know. We're looking to have a few meetups with awesome speakers & thought leaders starting the night's conversation. -------- Side note: Sarnie's cafe accepts Bitcoin, and they're really being cool by giving us so much of their space at peak hours to have our meetup there. So, it's cool and supportive if you order from their menu (for bitcoin, of course). They also happen to make shockingly delicious food (I highly recommend the Chicken In A Paper Bag), and damn good coffee (their own custom house blend).

events.name: Microspace Nanosatellites, aiming at targets far, far away
events.description:
Join us for an exciting tech talk with Dr Giulio Manzoni, founder of Microspace Rapid Pte Ltd, the first and only Singapore small medium enterprise to concieve and develop nanosatellites. Dr Giulio will share with us about the POPSAT-HIP1, the first made-in-Singapore nanosatellite that was launched into space on June 2014, and the ATHENOXAT-1, an experimental nanosatellite for nocturnal observation which was launched into space on 16th December 2015.

Microspace vision is to excel at the front line of nanosatellites R&D, developing full satellites, innovative propulsion systems and optical payloads to enable the reduction of size and increased efficiency of spacecrafts for a more sustainable use of our Space.

Present in Singapore since 2007, Microspace Rapid early projects includes micropumps, electronic controls and pressurized gas containers to complete the system producing fully controllable thrust in the range of 100 microN to 10mN which enables fine attitude control and formation flight of nanosatellites of 1kg to microsatellites of 100kg mass.

events.name: IxD Session: A conversation with Wang Xiaodan
events.description: Hey everyone! This 3rd instalment of the design leader series we are honoured to have Wang Xiaodan, Head of Design at Grab to share with us her experience and journey.  About Xiaodan With over 16 years of experience in the design field, Xiaodan currently leads the design team at Grab with the mission of bringing Grab's user experience to the next level and fostering a design, research, innovation & data driven culture within the company. Known by her peers as a leader that brings the best out of those around her, Xiaodan has been in multiple design leadership roles including as the Lead Consultant - Experience Design in Thoughtworks and Head of User Experience Design, Yahoo Southeast Asia. She was also recently invited as a speaker for the Singapore Design Week and supported the Singapore Design Council as a panelist for their Singapore 8 Years Design Planning event. P.s from Xiaodan:  Grab is currently hiring UX, Visual design, research, prototyping, content strategist, if interested pls send me your CV and portfolio: xiao.dan@grab.com , thanks. --- Agenda for the night  7pm – 7.30pm: Registration and networking 7.30pm – 8.30pm: Conversation with Xiaodan 8.30pm – 9pm: Networking and drinks :) We're hoping to keep the session really informal and casual where it is more conversational centric so bring along some of your burning questions to the session. Also, if you would like to ask the question privately, please email me at kiat@ixda.sg and I'll ask them on your behalf :) Alternatively, feel free to tweet us the questions to @IxDASG and we can have that answered!
events.location: Grab, 138 Cecil Street, #16-01 Cecil Court, Singapore 069538, Singapore

events.name: Docker and Data modeling night!
events.description:
Here we go again for another Spring User Group event! We will meet at 7PM as usual and will mingle/ have pizzas until 7.30PM. We will then have 2 talks. Level of Spring: low (*) Food sponsor for this event: Pivotal First Talk: Solving Developer pains with Docker! (Srikanth Nutigattu and Germain Potet) With the advent of different libraries, tools and environments it is becoming challenging to maintain a sane development environment, due to version conflicts, local path overwrites, polluting global space.   Working on different projects or switching between projects is becoming difficult. Onboarding new developers take time due to their dev machine setup. Srikanth and Germain will show you how Docker can solve the developer side problems, in addition to solving the deployment side! 


Second Talk: Data modeling (Eric Vergnaud) We have interviewed Eric here.Data modeling can be a challenging activity when spanning across relational, object and functional models.In his talk, Eric walks us through the issues. He will then explain the benefits of a new data modeling paradigm based on attributes reification. He will show technologies which already use it, and he will unveil an experimental programming language called Prompto, built for purpose. He will finally provide guidance on how to improve data modeling in Java and SQL. 


(*) Note about our "Level of Spring" rating: our Singapore Spring User Group is the best place for Java/Spring developers to meet and discuss topics that are relevant to their everyday programing life. Some of our talks are not directly related to Spring.
events.location: PayPal office in Suntec, 5 Temasek Blvd, #09-01 Suntec Tower Five, 038985 Nearest Mrt:Promenade(Yellow Line), Singapore

events.name: June Meetup: The Tried & Tested
events.description:
Hello fellow Djangonauts! Last meetup was awesome, so let's do it again! We had identified lots of topics for potential future talks and presentations but the one topic that almost no one had touched yet was Test Driven Development with Django. This is not acceptable. We need to fix that :) --------------------------------- Agenda: 7pm: Welcome and mingle, enjoy some Pizza 7:30pm: Talk: The Django Test Driven Development Cookbook by Martin Brochhaus Martin is currently working as the CTO of theartling.com and luxglove.com and is maintaining a codebase with ~30k lines of code and ~12k lines of tests. In this 45 minutes talk, he will show how you can setup your first Django test-suite with py.test, how you can create fixtures with mixer and how you can measure test coverage. He will also show common patterns and snippets that will help you overtake the initial hurdles of getting in to testing: How to speed up tests? How to mock third party libraries? How to test forms and class based views with Django's RequestFactory? How to test admin functions and management commands? How to test Django Rest Framework's API views and serializers?  8:30pm. Talk: ??? by ??? 

We are looking for one more 30-45 minutes talk. If anyone would like to present something, please message Martin Brochhaus on Facebook or here on meetup.com. 9:30pm: The End --------------------------------- As always, a big Thank You goes out to our friendly sponsors: Pivotal - for venue sponsorship

events.name: Open Space @ Sandcraw­ler (Self-organizing teams)
events.description: Open Space Facilitator: Steven Koh from IDA-GDS Open Space Theme: Self-organising teams. AOB: Drivers may park their cars at Galaxis or Fusionopolis. Sandcrawler does not provide parking for visitors. Agenda 7:00pm - Networking and food 7:30pm - Topic generation 8:00pm - Breakout sessions 10:00pm - End We welcome contributions of drinks and snacks! =) What is Open Space? Open Space is a highly collaborative and self-organised meeting where topics are generated on the spot and discussed by the participants through breakout sessions. For more information read Open Space Technology. Venue and food sponsor
